result.execSummary:
The defendant Rhonda M Rachal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Rhonda M Rachal in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 16CF87 & 16CM11. Called at 3:53 PM. State here for change of plea. 16CF87 - Count 2 will be amended to FC ordinance of possession of drug paraphernalia, Count 1 would plead to as alleged and count 3 will be DRI. 2 years probation, with conditions of 120 days conditional time in FC jail, AODA and follow through, no possession or consumption of alcohol, not to enter into any bar or tavern, FT emp/schooling, 100 hours community service, take all meds as prescribed, asks to be eligible for expunction. 16CM11 - plead to Count 1 (misd theft) - fine of $300 plus costs, pay restitution today of $240 to FC drug task force plus $24 victim witness fee. Joy agrees with the agreement. 16CM11 -  Rachal pleads guilty to Count 1. 16CF87 - Court DRI count 3, amends Count 2 to FC ordinance of possession of drug paraphernalia, Rachal pleads guilty to the amend count. Court imposes fine of $500 plus costs, apply any bond posted. Rachal pleads guilty to Count 1. Court goes over plea questionnaire and finds Rachal is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering her plea and right to trial, court finds factual basis and adjudges guilty. State makes final statement and has complied with victim witness notification. Joy makes final statement, asks for expunction and to follow joint recommendation. Rachal with holds statement. Court will accept joint recommendation and sentences the defendant to the following: 16CF87 - Count 1: With hold sentence place on probation for 2 years, 120 conditional days in FC jail with huber and eligible for community service, impose fine $300 plus costs to be paid within 60 days, AODA and follow through with recommendations, no possession or consumption of alcohol, not to enter into any bar or tavern, must obtain GED, FT emp/schooling, 100 hours community service within first year of probation, take all medications as prescribed by medical doctor. 16CM11 - Court sentences to the following: Count 1 - $300 fine plus costs within 60 days, restitution of $240 plus VW surcharge to be paid today (7/6/16). Appeal rights given, DNA sample with expunction rights. Credit for 1 day if revoked. Authorizes expunction in both cases, advises of following all conditions of probation in order for expunction. Joy asks for time to report to jail. State does not object but has some concerns as not being able to sign up for probation today. Court will allow defendant to report on or before Monday, July 11, 2016 at 8:30 AM.

Defendant Rhonda M Rachal in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 4:08 PM. Also called 16CM11. State - here for PH on felony case and BBH on misd case but believes the PH will be waived. Joy and Rachal agree. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files an Information that mirrors the complaint. Joy has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court will now take up the bail bond hearing as the poster wants the money back and he is in Court today. Poster Olds states that he does want his bond money back. Joy makes argument for signature bond on both cases for stated reasons. State - bond - no objections to a signature bond on the felony case but did have a warrant at one time on misd case and would like $300.00 cash on that matter. Joy responds, still requests signature bond as the defendant has contacted him right away. Rachal makes statement. Court has reviewed the files - bond - $1000.00 sigantreu bond on each case with same conditions, refund bond to poster. Court sets for FPT on both matters.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on April 25, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Jeffery Joy in court who appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 10:00 AM. Called 16CF87 & 16CM11. Joy states that he has received a call from the client and she is on her way, asking that the matter be recalled when she appears. Recess at 10:02 AM. Recalled at 10:38 AM. Rhonda Rachal is now present in the Courtroom and her attorney, Jeff Joy, appears telephoinically with leave of the Court. Rachal and Joy have complaints on both matters, waives reading of the, waives time limits for PH (16CF87). Court continues bond, sets for PH on 4/25/16 at 3:30 PM. On 16CM11, Rachal states that she did not have a ride for the last court date. Court instructs the defendant on the importance of coming to Court. Joy - bond - asks for signature bond for stated reasons. Court - bond - $300.00 cash that has already been posted, no consumption of alcohol, no contact with Forest County Drug Task Force. Joy pleads NG to all counts on this matter and states that he has previously advised the defendant of the charges and penalties. Set for STC on 4/25/16 at 3:30 PM.
Return on warrant on April 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.
arrested FOSO

Defendant Rhonda M Rachal not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:35 AM. State - wants Court to check to see if the defendant was notified of today's hearing. Notice was sent on 3/14/16. State asks for bench warrant, body or $300.00. Court so orders.
Initial appearance on March 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.
